alert.note: Alert for Maryland Beaches (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued August 30 at 3:50PM EDT until August 31 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents and large battering waves expected. * WHERE...Coastal Worcester County Maryland, including Ocean City. * WHEN...Through Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...Breaking waves of 4 to 7 ft will result in rough surf conditions and a high risk of rip currents. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. OCEAN CITY INLET MD MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 4.0 FT, MODERATE 5.0 FT, MAJOR 6.0 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.5 FT, MODERATE 2.5 FT, MAJOR 3.5 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 30/08 PM 3.6 1.1 0.5 1 NONE 31/09 AM 3.5 1.0 0.8 1 NONE 31/09 PM 4.0 1.5 0.9 1 MINOR 01/10 AM 3.4 0.9 0.6 1 NONE 01/10 PM 3.5 1.0 0.5 1 NONE 02/10 AM 3.3 0.8 0.4 1 NONE &&
info.instruction: Life-threatening rip currents. If caught in a rip current, remain calm. Swim in a direction following the shoreline. If tired, float or tread water until out of the rip current. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
